info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 10 at 4:03AM EDT until September 10 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Upton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the Coastal Flood Statement, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline.
* WHERE...Southern Queens County.
* WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 7 AM this morning to 1 PM EDT this afternoon.
* COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline.
* RIP CURRENT IMPACTS...Life threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
Do not drive through flooded roadways.
If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.

parameter.value: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
